title: Thank you and farewell speech

author: Iztok Kosem, Trojina – Institute for Applied Slovene Studies

segmentation: I'm almost sad it's over.
I'm now I'm a bit tired but it's it's really it's been a great conference for us and I'll get to that bit later, but still just some closing words.
First of all, I think we had a great lectures altogether from keynotes to all the presentations, so I would like to thank all the presenters and keynote speakers for making this conference.
Very thought provoking.
An inspiring so thank you all.
I was, I mean all the time throughout the conference.
There all all different questions asked and sometimes answered, sometimes not, and especially yesterday at the round table.
So, um, I'd like to return back to that because I think it's.
It's what the conference is all about, and it shows what people are thinking about and where the problem may lie.
So just first of all, it's designed this into sort of a dialogue, so we hope you'll bear with me base.
So will there still be a dictionaries and imagine this is a computer dialogue which will happen, I think into 2020 or it's already happening.
So.
It's not a simple question.
And I think it's very safe to say that it's not.
It should be.
More precise so.
A different question is, will there still be paper dictionaries 2020 and?

I think this is the answer and this is my opinion because as we saw as we heard yesterday, there still arguments not cause that the paper the electronic dictionaries will replace the paper addictions.
But because some places in the world they don't have the necessary technology to be able to use them.
So we just have to acknowledge that fact.
But the conference is not about that, we are the decide representing the electronic part of the electric lexicography.
So the question.
I mean, this is just I just took a brief look about the latest information about the Internet penetration rates.
And it does show.
So where I mean Europe and over have representatives from Asia United States.
But it does show where there's still big market for paper dictionaries in my opinion.
Um?
Now, one of the things the question was and the phrase is often mentioned was digital natives.
And.
For all of you that were the gala dinner yesterday.
You saw Marco singing and I remembered one of his presentation is a very good one on dictionaries.
An I I took a Liberty to borrow two of his pictures.
Now.
This is imagine this girl being a digital native, frequently talking about children and she gets a present now the press.
Is this a dictionary?
You see the face, so this is the I know we're talking about the users of paper dictionaries as well, but these are the.
This is the digital natives.
This is normally their reaction to when they get a Dictionary of this type.
I and going back to the discussion yesterday on.
That we need to teach dictionary skills.
I think this is very, very much true.

However, we need to also think about whether the teaching of dictionary skills may need to be changed because the way I was taught how to use dictionaries and the way we still have a dictionary skills in our curricula, it's often perceived as the main domain.
One of the starting points are knowing the alphabet.
You know, knowing how to search the words when they're alphabetised, so that's where you start.
Well, if your digital native and you use it electronically so you don't need that skill, so you need to keyboard that and so we have been.
It's been discussed at this conference that the searching skills will become the ones to acquire.
Searching the information an we're the ones to provide information in different ways.
But perhaps we also need to think about teaching young generations and the old ones how to find that information.
Now the next questions for the computer, will there still be in dictionaries in 2020 and from what I gathered at the Conf?
Once.
Yes, but.
Not many people will call them dictionaries.
Not many people call him today, but that's I think the only difference will still perceive them as dictionaries in lexicographic community.
But the users will call them differently.
So this would be sort of a.
A summary of the conference.
Hope you would agree, I think.
It just shows that there are so many questions open still that I would think that hopefully in two years we would have another conference.
I've heard some people saying that you know, will it happen and I just want to sort of feel the audience whether you think we should have another conference.
What do you think?
Should we have another conference?
Only lexicography, yes, that's the answer.
We want to hear.
Anne.
Yes.
We need to have a few more before then and then, yes, even saying that we don't know if they're going to be dictionaries in 2020, but I'm sure there's not going to be any great dancing until then.
Yes, wait, it's coming.
We had.
Um?
So I'm glad to hear there is interest, and I'm sure it may not happen here.
I know people like to travel around to different places so you seen Blade and I hope you still will see it in the next day or today.
But I also invite whoever if there any interesting people in organizing to contact us.
We won't be a.
We won't be helping you because we would like to participate, but we can offer Contacts and all the advice so.
Um, now it's the.
It's again my turn.
To pink First of all, the sponsors.
I know I've thanked them at the beginning yesterday and I think I should thank them again because it's the sponsors that also make these things happen.
Is the sponsors that believe in the lexicography they have interest in it, but they also support the cause.
And then people who haven't been.
Mentioned often enough, it's the organizing committee.
I was here running the show from the front, but they were really making things happen so.
So I'm sure it's at some point during the conference you met all of them.
So from Carmen Poland Summit, it's Natasha below 9 Daria.
And of course the Simone.
He was also had his hand in organizing the conference and a round table which he took off my hands.
Thank you so much for that.
And they.
And also have to thank the Hotel Compass for providing this great venue and Technical Support.
Solving all of our problems on time.
I apologize for any wireless problems you had, but I heard that most of them are all of them got resolved at some point or the other.
I also would like to thank the restaurant logs for being a venue for a gala dinner and more than that and to the.
And colicky.
Oh sorry, Laborte correcting me already.
Sorry law, it is the next hotel and I knew I would make a mistake at some point.
And of course, the taxi company I'd like to take them already, although they were still taking you back so.
The video lectures for recording will let you know when the recordings are available and then to ASH.
Who's our official photographer.
Some of you already took the advantage of taking some nice scenery photos.
I have a brief sort of preview of some of the photographs that were taken during the.
So to start.
Off some of the listening.
Then you did sort of play around with the.
Some of the digital devices.
Um?
Yes, I didn't do the organizing, only I.
Did a bit of talking as well.
Now that's the I know you were all expecting this so.
And.
So on this note, the photos will be made available to you will send a link to some to the site where we stored them.
We will also distribute the list of participants with affiliation and email addresses, so you can all network even after the conference if there is anything else.
Feel free to contact us after the conference if you have any of your own photos, please send us.
If you have any sort of feedback.
Any comments, please let us know.
And that would be it for me.
Thank you very much.
